subject: Running
Suspensions, Dismissals and Resignations
Track and Field
lead_paragraph: The Kenyan distance runner Susan Chepkemei was suspended for one year by the I.A.A.F. after testing positive for salbutamol, an asthma medication.Her agent, Valentijn Trouw, said Tuesday that Chepkemei was given salbutamol in September by a doctor after she became pregnant and developed pneumonia. Trouw said Chepkemei got a shorter suspension instead of the usual two-year ban for a first-time offender because of her illness.
